segment.source: Installing Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Installing Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Installing Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Installing Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Installing Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Installing Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services and Windows Assessment Services - Client (Windows ASC) are available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services and Windows Assessment Services - Client (Windows ASC) are available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).

segment.source: You can install or download the Windows ADK and select which features that you want to install.
segment.target: You can install or download the Windows ADK and select which features that you want to install.

segment.source: You must install Windows Assessment Services on a server computer, which also installs Windows ASC on the server.
segment.target: You must install Windows Assessment Services on a server computer, which also installs Windows ASC on the server.

segment.source: You can also install a stand-alone version of Windows ASC on a client computer and use it to connect to Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: You can also install a stand-alone version of Windows ASC on a client computer and use it to connect to Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Services server supports Preboot Execution Environment (PXE)-based image deployment by using Windows Deployment Services.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Services server supports Preboot Execution Environment (PXE)-based image deployment by using Windows Deployment Services.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Services server also maintains your inventory database, job shares, result shares, and various scripts that are used for automation.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Services server also maintains your inventory database, job shares, result shares, and various scripts that are used for automation.

segment.source: You can use Windows ASC to manage assets that are in the inventory, set up and schedule projects and jobs, monitor progress, and view results.
segment.target: You can use Windows ASC to manage assets that are in the inventory, set up and schedule projects and jobs, monitor progress, and view results.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: Server Computer
segment.target: Server Computer

segment.source: To install Windows Assessment Services, your server must meet the following requirements:
segment.target: To install Windows Assessment Services, your server must meet the following requirements:

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise, Standard, or Datacenter edition.
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise, Standard, or Datacenter edition.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is not supported on Server Core, Windows Server Essentials, or a server that is a Domain Controller.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is not supported on Server Core, Windows Server Essentials, or a server that is a Domain Controller.

segment.source: Windows ASC is installed with Windows Assessment Services by default.
segment.target: Windows ASC is installed with Windows Assessment Services by default.

segment.source: You must install Remote Management 3.0 to run Windows ASC on Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: You must install Remote Management 3.0 to run Windows ASC on Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a Windows Server 2012 server, Windows Deployment Services (WDS) is configured as follows:
segment.target: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a Windows Server 2012 server, Windows Deployment Services (WDS) is configured as follows:

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services, Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Transport-Server, and Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Deployment-Server are enabled.
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services, Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Transport-Server, and Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Deployment-Server are enabled.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is listed as the first provider in the list of providers for client boot services over the network.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is listed as the first provider in the list of providers for client boot services over the network.

segment.source: If WDS is not initialized, Windows Assessment Services initializes it and sets the REMINST folder to %SYSTEMDRIVE%REMINST.
segment.target: If WDS is not initialized, Windows Assessment Services initializes it and sets the REMINST folder to %SYSTEMDRIVE%REMINST.

segment.source: Boot .wim files that are installed with Windows Assessment Services are added to the WDS image inventory.
segment.target: Boot .wim files that are installed with Windows Assessment Services are added to the WDS image inventory.

segment.source: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a Windows Server 2008 R2 server, Windows Deployment Services (WDS) is configured as follows:
segment.target: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a Windows Server 2008 R2 server, Windows Deployment Services (WDS) is configured as follows:

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services and Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Transport-Server are enabled.
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services and Microsoft-Windows-Deployment-Services-Transport-Server are enabled.

segment.source: The REMINST share is created at %SYSTEMDRIVE%REMINST, the folder is shared, and the permissions are set for the Windows ASC user (localadmin).
segment.target: The REMINST share is created at %SYSTEMDRIVE%REMINST, the folder is shared, and the permissions are set for the Windows ASC user (localadmin).

segment.source: Boot files are copied from the Windows Assessment Services installation directory …/relax/scripts, to the REMINST share.
segment.target: Boot files are copied from the Windows Assessment Services installation directory …/relax/scripts, to the REMINST share.

segment.source: The WDS component, Wdstftp, is configured.
segment.target: The WDS component, Wdstftp, is configured.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is listed as the first provider in the list of providers for client boot services over the network.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is listed as the first provider in the list of providers for client boot services over the network.

segment.source: Boot .wim files that were installed with Windows Assessment Services are added to the WDS image inventory.
segment.target: Boot .wim files that were installed with Windows Assessment Services are added to the WDS image inventory.

segment.source: The WDS server is restarted.
segment.target: The WDS server is restarted.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a server, Windows Deployment Services is enabled with these benefits and limitations:
segment.target: When you install Windows Assessment Services on a server, Windows Deployment Services is enabled with these benefits and limitations:

segment.source: Windows Deployment Services is configured to automate PXE-based computer discovery and image deployment.
segment.target: Windows Deployment Services is configured to automate PXE-based computer discovery and image deployment.

segment.source: When deploying an image to test computers, you must use a Windows image (.wim) file that has been generalized using the sysprep tool.
segment.target: When deploying an image to test computers, you must use a Windows image (.wim) file that has been generalized using the sysprep tool.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services on Windows Server 2012 uses Windows Deployment Services Dynamic Driver Provisioning (DDP) to inject matching Plug and Play drivers during image deployment.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services on Windows Server 2012 uses Windows Deployment Services Dynamic Driver Provisioning (DDP) to inject matching Plug and Play drivers during image deployment.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services doesn't support DDP on Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services doesn't support DDP on Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: On either server operating system, you can use DISM.exe to inject drivers into the .wim image offline before deployment.
segment.target: On either server operating system, you can use DISM.exe to inject drivers into the .wim image offline before deployment.

segment.source: If the server is a domain member, you must set the Internet Protocol security (IPsec) exclusion policy to use Windows Deployment Services to deploy image and run assessments on test computers.
segment.target: If the server is a domain member, you must set the Internet Protocol security (IPsec) exclusion policy to use Windows Deployment Services to deploy image and run assessments on test computers.

segment.source: You can skip Windows Deployment Services image deployment if the test computer already has a supported running operating system, or if it has an image that is deployed outside Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: You can skip Windows Deployment Services image deployment if the test computer already has a supported running operating system, or if it has an image that is deployed outside Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) is supported.
segment.target: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) is supported.

segment.source: The Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 and the .NET Framework 4
segment.target: The Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 and the .NET Framework 4

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For Windows Server 2008 R2, the .NET Framework 3.5 is installed by default and the .NET Framework 4 is installed with the Assessment Toolkit.
segment.target: For Windows Server 2008 R2, the .NET Framework 3.5 is installed by default and the .NET Framework 4 is installed with the Assessment Toolkit.

segment.source: For Windows Server 2012, the .NET Framework 4 is installed by default and you must enable the .NET Framework 3.5 before you install Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For Windows Server 2012, the .NET Framework 4 is installed by default and you must enable the .NET Framework 3.5 before you install Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: To enable the .NET Framework 3.5, on the server, at the command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: To enable the .NET Framework 3.5, on the server, at the command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: Network: 1-gigabyte (GB) network adapter
segment.target: Network: 1-gigabyte (GB) network adapter

segment.source: Hard disk space: 50 GB of memory per test computer.
segment.target: Hard disk space: 50 GB of memory per test computer.

segment.source: Memory: 8 GB minimum, 16 GB for servers that support more than 100 test computers.
segment.target: Memory: 8 GB minimum, 16 GB for servers that support more than 100 test computers.

segment.source: Technician’s computer
segment.target: Technician’s computer

segment.source: By default, the Windows ASC is installed on the server where you installed Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: By default, the Windows ASC is installed on the server where you installed Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: You can also install it on a client computer.
segment.target: You can also install it on a client computer.

segment.source: To install Windows ASC, your computer must be running one of these operating systems:
segment.target: To install Windows ASC, your computer must be running one of these operating systems:

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Remote Management 3.0 installed
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Remote Management 3.0 installed

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Test computers
segment.target: Test computers

segment.source: Test computers must meet these requirements:
segment.target: Test computers must meet these requirements:

segment.source: USB boot support
segment.target: USB boot support

segment.source: Network (PXE) boot support
segment.target: Network (PXE) boot support

segment.source: Network adapter driver
segment.target: Network adapter driver

segment.source: Network infrastructure
segment.target: Network infrastructure

segment.source: At a minimum, your network infrastructure should meet these requirements:
segment.target: At a minimum, your network infrastructure should meet these requirements:

segment.source: All computers must be on the same subnet.
segment.target: All computers must be on the same subnet.

segment.source: If not, the IP address of the Windows Assessment Services server and Windows Deployment Services should be in the IP Helper address list of the switches for all the test computers that you are deploying by using Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: If not, the IP address of the Windows Assessment Services server and Windows Deployment Services should be in the IP Helper address list of the switches for all the test computers that you are deploying by using Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: A Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server must be available on the same network to assign IP addresses to test computers.
segment.target: A Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server must be available on the same network to assign IP addresses to test computers.

segment.source: Security Note:
segment.target: Security Note:

segment.source: For security purposes, limit access to the Windows Assessment Services server by doing one of the following:
segment.target: For security purposes, limit access to the Windows Assessment Services server by doing one of the following:

segment.source: Block port 8000 for users outside the same subset by using Group Policy if computers are on a domain, or by an administrator if in a workgroup.
segment.target: Block port 8000 for users outside the same subset by using Group Policy if computers are on a domain, or by an administrator if in a workgroup.

segment.source: Edit a firewall rule on the server to define the scope as:
segment.target: Edit a firewall rule on the server to define the scope as:

segment.source: A specific subnet
segment.target: A specific subnet

segment.source: A specific IP range
segment.target: A specific IP range

segment.source: A predefined set of computers
segment.target: A predefined set of computers

segment.source: Specific users or specific computers
segment.target: Specific users or specific computers

segment.source: Installing Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Installing Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You can upgrade to a newer version of Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: You can upgrade to a newer version of Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: When you upgrade, assessment results on the server will be preserved.
segment.target: When you upgrade, assessment results on the server will be preserved.

segment.source: Project, job, and job information will not be preserved.
segment.target: Project, job, and job information will not be preserved.

segment.source: On the server computer, double-click ADKSetup.exe.
segment.target: On the server computer, double-click ADKSetup.exe.

segment.source: Click Download to download the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Click Download to download the Windows ADK.

segment.source: Or, if the server can remain connected to the Internet during setup, click Install.
segment.target: Or, if the server can remain connected to the Internet during setup, click Install.

segment.source: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms.
segment.target: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms.

segment.source: Select the following features:
segment.target: Select the following features:

segment.source: Deployment Tools
segment.target: Deployment Tools

segment.source: Windows Preinstallation Environment
segment.target: Windows Preinstallation Environment

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Windows Performance Toolkit
segment.target: Windows Performance Toolkit

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An instance of Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express is installed together with Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: An instance of Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express is installed together with Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: The name of the instance of SQL Server is ADK.
segment.target: The name of the instance of SQL Server is ADK.

segment.source: If an instance of SQL Server that is named ADK already exists, you should remove or rename it before you install Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: If an instance of SQL Server that is named ADK already exists, you should remove or rename it before you install Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: If you don’t, the existing instance is used.
segment.target: If you don’t, the existing instance is used.

segment.source: By default, Windows ASC is also installed together with Windows Assessment Services on the server.
segment.target: By default, Windows ASC is also installed together with Windows Assessment Services on the server.

segment.source: Installing Windows Assessment Services - Client
segment.target: Installing Windows Assessment Services - Client

segment.source: By default, Windows ASC is installed on the server when you install Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: By default, Windows ASC is installed on the server when you install Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: However, you can also install it on a client (or technician) computer.
segment.target: However, you can also install it on a client (or technician) computer.

segment.source: On the technician's computer, double-click ADKSetup.exe.
segment.target: On the technician's computer, double-click ADKSetup.exe.

segment.source: Click Download to download the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Click Download to download the Windows ADK.

segment.source: Or, if the computer can remain connected to the Internet during setup, click Install.
segment.target: Or, if the computer can remain connected to the Internet during setup, click Install.

segment.source: Select Deployment Tools, Windows Assessment Services-Client, and Windows Performance Toolkit, and then click Install.
segment.target: Select Deployment Tools, Windows Assessment Services-Client, and Windows Performance Toolkit, and then click Install.

segment.source: Backing up the Windows Assessment Services Inventory Database
segment.target: Backing up the Windows Assessment Services Inventory Database

segment.source: If you are going to upgrade the server operating system where Windows Assessment Services is installed, you must back up the Windows Assessment Services inventory database and any relevant customized scripts.
segment.target: If you are going to upgrade the server operating system where Windows Assessment Services is installed, you must back up the Windows Assessment Services inventory database and any relevant customized scripts.

segment.source: Although it isn't required, if you are uninstalling and re-installing Windows Assessment Services, we also recommend backing up the database and customized scripts.
segment.target: Although it isn't required, if you are uninstalling and re-installing Windows Assessment Services, we also recommend backing up the database and customized scripts.

segment.source: To back up the Windows Assessment Services inventory database
segment.target: To back up the Windows Assessment Services inventory database

segment.source: Install Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio Express (ENUx86SQLManagementStudiox86ENU.exe), from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: Install Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio Express (ENUx86SQLManagementStudiox86ENU.exe), from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: Use net stop wassvc to stop Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: Use net stop wassvc to stop Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and detach the Windows Assessment Services database.
segment.target: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and detach the Windows Assessment Services database.

segment.source: For more information about how to detach a database using SQL Server Management Studio 2012, see MSDN: Detach a Database.
segment.target: For more information about how to detach a database using SQL Server Management Studio 2012, see MSDN: Detach a Database.

segment.source: Copy the database (.mdb file) and transaction logs from %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases, to a secure backup location.
segment.target: Copy the database (.mdb file) and transaction logs from %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases, to a secure backup location.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you have customized scripts in the …/relax/scripts folder, also copy them to a secure backup location.
segment.target: If you have customized scripts in the …/relax/scripts folder, also copy them to a secure backup location.

segment.source: Uninstall Windows Assessment Services, upgrade your server operating system, and then re-install Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: Uninstall Windows Assessment Services, upgrade your server operating system, and then re-install Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Initialize the Windows Assessment Services server by opening Windows ASC, and connecting to the server.
segment.target: Initialize the Windows Assessment Services server by opening Windows ASC, and connecting to the server.

segment.source: Use net stop wassvc to stop Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: Use net stop wassvc to stop Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and detach the new Windows Assessment Services database that was created when you initialized the Windows Assessment Services server.
segment.target: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and detach the new Windows Assessment Services database that was created when you initialized the Windows Assessment Services server.

segment.source: Remove the new database from %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases.
segment.target: Remove the new database from %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases.

segment.source: Copy the old database from the backup location to %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases.
segment.target: Copy the old database from the backup location to %SystemDrive%ProgramDataWindows Assessment Servicesdatabases.

segment.source: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and attach the Windows Assessment Services database.
segment.target: Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012 and attach the Windows Assessment Services database.

segment.source: For more information about how to attach a database using SQL Server Management Studio 2012, see MSDN: Attach a Database.
segment.target: For more information about how to attach a database using SQL Server Management Studio 2012, see MSDN: Attach a Database.

segment.source: Put your customized scripts back in the …/relax/scripts directory.
segment.target: Put your customized scripts back in the …/relax/scripts directory.

segment.source: Use net start wassvc to start Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: Use net start wassvc to start Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: After installing Windows Assessment Services and the Windows ASC, initialize the server and configure communication between Windows Assessment Services and the Windows ASC computers.
segment.target: After installing Windows Assessment Services and the Windows ASC, initialize the server and configure communication between Windows Assessment Services and the Windows ASC computers.

segment.source: You can configure more than one Windows ASC computer to communicate with the Windows Assessment Services server.
segment.target: You can configure more than one Windows ASC computer to communicate with the Windows Assessment Services server.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services Setup and Configuration.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services Setup and Configuration.

segment.target: Related topics
